Package controller

Class AllClientsScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.AllClientsScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AllClientsScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the AllClientsScreen.fxml document and is not meant to be instantiated. This class populates the data for the Customers table, as well as provide the functionality for the buttons on the screen.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called by the FXMLLoader.load() call contained in the toAllCustomersScreen() method of the AdminHomeScreenController class. The method populates the table with every Client that is in the database.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      resourceBundle - An unreferenced ResourceBundle object passed automatically
      url - An unreferenced URL object passed automatically

    • searchClients

      public void searchClients(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the searchTextField. Search function searches the allCustomersList for matches containing either the string or ID entered.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the text field.

    • onDeleteClient

      public void onDeleteClient(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      This method is an event handler on the "Delete Client" button. When clicked, an alert will pop up asking the User to verify that they wish to delete the Client and all associated Appointments. Upon confirmation, the Client will be deleted from the database and the display table updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the "Delete Client" button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Exception gets thrown if the SQL code does not compute properly.

    • toAdminCreateClientScreen

      public void toAdminCreateClientScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the "New Client" button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AddModifyCustomerScreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the "New Client" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • toAdminEditClientScreen

      public void toAdminEditClientScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the Edit Client Info button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AdminCreateEditClientScreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Edit Client Info button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • toAdminHomeScreen

      public void toAdminHomeScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler for the Back button that sends the program back to the AdminHomeScreen. The method loads the FXML document for the AdminHomeScreen, passes that to a new scene and then sets the stage with the new scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Back button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The FXMLLoader.load() call will throw this exception if the FXML document can't be found.

    • sortClientsByRegion

      public void sortClientsByRegion(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method sorts the allCustomersList by region and displays the results in the table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the regionComboBox.

    • displayAllRegions

      public void displayAllRegions(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method restores the customer table to display customers from all regions/
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on allRegionsRadioButton.

    • toSignOut

      public void toSignOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the SignOut button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the original Login Screen
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the SignOut button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file
